= Scenarios =

Examples of normal use of GCMUtils.

== "I only need to send registration id" ==
The simple case. You only need to send the registration id (both for registration and unregistration).

  # Add gcm-client-utils.jar and gcm-common-utils.jar to the project (see [https://code.google.com/p/gcmutils/wiki/ProjectSetup project setup]).
  # Update the AndroidManifest.xml with the required information (see [http://developer.android.com/google/gcm/gs.html GCM Getting Started]).
  # In you main activity, add the following code:
{{{
GCMRegistrar.checkDevice(this);
GCMUtils.checkExtended(this);
GCMUtils.getAndSendRegistrationId(this);
}}}
  # Add the gcmutils.properties in the assets folder and add the _receiver-url_, _sender-id_ and _check-extended_:
{{{
# Required
receiver-url=
sender-id=

# optional
# values: enabled/disabled
check-extended=enabled
}}}
  # Create a class called GCMIntentService and extend GCMUtilsBaseIntentService. Override the onError and onMessage methods:
{{{
@Override
protected void onMessage(Context context, String msg) {
}

@Override
protected void onError(Context context, String s) {
}
}}}
